abstract: Charleston, SC, recognized for its historic downtown buildings, is embroiled in controversy over what kind of new architecture to erect in city undergoing period of expansion and economic growth; modernists have butted heads with traditionalists as city grapples with its new identity as booming metropolis versus its longtime reliance on charm and tourist dollars.
lead_paragraph: Accustomed to basing its identity on its grand old buildings, the South Carolina city now finds it almost impossible to agree on how to build new ones as its economy and its population grow.
snippet: Accustomed to basing its identity on its grand old buildings, the South Carolina city now finds it almost impossible to agree on how to build new ones as its economy and its population grow.

headline.main: In Stately Old Charleston, the New Buildings on the Block Are Struggling to Fit In
headline.print_headline: In Stately Old Charleston, the New Buildings on the Block Are Struggling to Fit In
